title: Investors' money can never be completely safe, says watchdog boss Andrew Bailey
text:
Investors must be allowed to suffer losses if the economy is to thrive, City watchdog boss Andrew Bailey has said.

Risk-taking is essential for growth, Mr Bailey said, and the Financial Conduct Authority should not seek to prevent it even if savers lose out.

His remarks are likely to be seen as a response to criticism of how the FCA handled the collapse of Neil Woodford's investment empire, which imploded last week after the stock picker ploughed cash into risky privately owned businesses.

description: Investors must be allowed to suffer losses if the economy is to thrive, City watchdog boss Andrew Bailey has said.
